intro: Commelina forskailii, commonly known as the narrow-leaf commelina, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Commelinaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant features slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, blue or violet flowers with three petals. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Its botanical characteristics make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
